alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 04 at 9:12PM PST until December 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TUESDAY TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...An extended period of sustained wave action is expected to continue through Wednesday morning as a series of fronts moves through the region. Multiple moderate to high swell trains are expected with a moderate risk of sneaker waves. Also, a High Surf Advisory has been issued to coincide with the largest breaking waves of 20 to 30 ft, expected from Tuesday afternoon into early Wednesday morning. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast and Curry County Coast. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Wednesday morning. For the High Surf Advisory, from 2 PM Tuesday to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Beaches will be hazardous places to be through the middle of the week. Jetties and rocks are not safe places to stand, and you will risk death if you are caught by waves on them. Beach erosion is possible. Sneaker waves can run up significantly farther on beaches than normal, including over rocks and jetties. These waves can suddenly knock people off of their feet and quickly pull them into the cold ocean waters, resulting in serious injury or death. Waves may also lift driftwood logs, trapping anyone caught underneath. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Stay away from the surf zone and off of jetties. Area beaches may become hazardous due to dangerous surf conditions. Avoid climbing on rocks and jetties. Stay away from the ocean and remain out of the water to avoid hazardous conditions.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
